headline: Gop Candidate Beats Trump Backed Opponent Texas House Runoff
summary: On Tuesday, Texas state Rep. Jake Ellzey defeated fellow Republican Susan Wright in a special election runoff for Texas' sixth congressional district.Wright had been widely favored to win. She's the widow of Ron Wright, who previously held the seat, and she had the endorsement of former president Donald Trump. Some political analysts paint the outcome as a loss for Trump and his post-election image; others say the runoff may not have been a clear test of his post-presidency clout because the special election was open to Independents and Democrats.
